p: Thiamine, also known as vitamin B1, is a cofactor of enzymes involved in glucose metabolism that was suggested to be linked to PD [ 101, 102]. Intramuscular injection of high-doses of thiamine significantly improved motor function in PD patients [ 103, 104]. Interestingly, thiamine was shown to reduce AGE levels in rodent models of diabetes [ 105] and to reduce glucose levels in hyperglycemic patients [ 106].
